title: What is true about jquery?
output: jQuery is a JavaScript Library.jQuery greatly simplifies JavaScript programming.jQuery is easy to learn.

title: Basic syntax is:?
output: Basic syntax is: $(selector).action()

title: Which code will hides all elements with class='test'?
output: $('.test').hide() - hides all elements with class='test'.

title: All selectors in jQuery start with the ?
output: All selectors in jQuery start with the dollar sign and parentheses: $().

title: Which of the following is correct Syntax to find elements with a specific class?
output: To find elements with a specific class, write a period character, followed by the name of the class : $('.test')

title: All the different visitors actions that a web page can respond to are called?
output: All the different visitors actions that a web page can respond to are called events.

output: The focus() method attaches an event handler function to an HTML form field.

title: Which built-in method removes the last element from an array and returns that element?
output: pop() method removes the last element from an array and returns that element.

title: Which of the following is not the feature of jQuery?
output: Powerful functional programming techniques is not used for operating on sets of elements as a group is not the feature of jQuery.

options.a: Efficient query method for finding the set of document elements
options.b: Expressive syntax for referring to elements in the document
options.c: Useful set of methods for manipulating selected elements

title: . jQuery is a ___________.
output: jQuery is a lightweight, 'write less, do more', JavaScript library.

title: Which code will hides the current element?
output: $(this).hide() - hides the current element.

title: jQuery uses ________ syntax to select elements
output: jQuery uses CSS syntax to select elements.

title: Which selector will finds elements with a specific class?
output: The jQuery .class selector finds elements with a specific class.

title: Which of the following is correct Syntax to find an element with a specific id?
output: To find an element with a specific id, write a hash character, followed by the id of the HTML element:$('#test')

title: The _____________ method attaches an event handler function to an HTML element.
output: The click() method attaches an event handler function to an HTML element

title: The blur() method attaches an event handler function to an HTML form field.
output: True, The blur() method attaches an event handler function to an HTML form field.

title: The on() method attaches an event handler function to an HTML form field.
output: The on() method attaches one or more event handlers for the selected elements.

title: Which built-in method sorts the elements of an array?
output: sort() method sorts the elements of an array.

title: Which of the following is a single global function defined in the jQuery library?
output: The jQuery library defines a single global function named jQuery(). This function is so frequently used that the library also defines the global symbol $ as a shortcut for it. The $ sign itâ€™s just an alias to jQuery(), then an alias to a function which is used as a selector element.
